history.content: CS 70 does not seem to be important for getting an internship.

children.subject:
The schedule is a little rigorous, but quite manageable. 

I think many students try to take it early to satisfy prerequisites for upper division courses.

Manageable, but like several other answers on Piazza, it really depends on the student.  Some students go with 2, 3, 4, 5 techs / semester on average; it really varies.  Also depends on how much you want to do outside of academics.

Physics 7B has a light homework load (online Mastering Physics; labs completed during lab time).  EE16B had more reasonable length homeworks than EE16A in my opinion.  That said, both of these classes will demand you to keep up with having a firm grasp of theoretical concepts (as with most any Berkeley tech class?? haha).

My rule of thumb is to take at most 3 techs per semester, and one of those techs is usually an "easier" one...like one that I feel I have somewhat of a grasp of what they will be teaching. That being said, the above comments are correct in saying that it really depends on the student. When I took CS61C, it was the class that I had to devote most of my time on. It is very fast paced and I had to work hard to keep up. Physics 7B was review for me up until the first midterm, after that it was all new material. I have not taken EE16B yet, so I cannot comment on that.

You really only need CS61B material for interviews. Personally, I think that CS70 is more beneficial for interviews for that first internship and you need it to declare. However, I do not think it will make much of a difference which one you take first. I do think its a good idea for you to wait until after you have finished the EE16 seires to take CS70, a lot of threads have shown that Profs recommend that.

So is the workload of Physics 7B, CS61C, and EE16B fine? And is it really fine to push off CS70 until the Spring whilst trying to secure an internship for next summer? I feel like many students try to take it as soon as possible.

history.content:
Hi, I was planning on taking 61C, Physics 7B, and EE16B for the upcoming semester. And then I'd be able to take CS70, along with an upper division cs class and a humanities during Spring 2018.

At the same time, I am very intent on getting an internship for the upcoming summer, and I heard that taking CS70 is important for securing an internship. Since the recruiting is taking place during the Fall semester, I was thinking that I could just study the material in my free time, but I really don't know what the right course of action is. 

Can someone provide input as to what the right thing to do is?
history.subject: Advice on Fall 2017 Schedule
